newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso ends down as Central Bank steps in.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso ends down as Central Bank steps in.

text.p: The Philippine peso ended lower at 26.242 to the dollar on Tuesday from 26.236 after the Central Bank bought dollars at 26.240, traders said.
But the day's average was 26.239 from 26.241, with turnover higher at $144.35 million from $113.50 million.
"The market just traded within a narrow range," said a foreign bank dealer.
Early morning trades saw the peso advancing to a high of 26.23 as interest arbitrage money came in to take advantage of the higher Treasury bill rates, traders said.
The Central Bank then stepped in to limit the peso's gains. One dealer estimated the Central Bank bought about $16 million at rates varying from 26.234, 26.239 to 26.24.
"Since the market knows the Central Bank was at 26.24, banks started buying dollars again," a dealer said.
Another dealer said dollar buying by banks was not that aggressive due to high domestic interest rates. "It's expensive to hold long dollars," he said.-LILIAN KARUNUNGAN (632) 841-8936
